content: a few rounds but i find i have more control over doing a nice tug and tighten if i cut it after i ve knit a few rounds with my new color i take the ends from both the new and the old cross them once gently tighten them checking on the front to see how it looks then cross them again and tighten them down in a knot then later i weave in the ends 1 in the first picture by 2 in the second the green marker you picture you can see can see there s a little how nice and snug gap this happens even it is after the tie more when you slip a tighten and knot stitch to minimize the color jog 4 if the front looks good make a 3 the 2 threads are second cross and crossed once and tighten it to create a tightened down check knot and tighten it the front to see if it looks down ends woven good in later mini tutorial on slip color join this is an easy way to add color when knitting in the round it adds a little visual interest and hides that color jog you get when joining a new color 2 slip the first stitch of the old color from the left needle to the right 1 you are just about to start the without working it do round where you want to add the this purlwise - like you new color were going to purl it 3 here you can see the slipped 4 insert your right stitch now on the right needle needle into the 2nd stitch and using your new color knit the stitch 5 slip the next stitch 6 repeat all the way around slip knit slip knit on the next round you ll only knit with the new color
